issues.title: Also provide JSO Schema?
issues.author: JKRhb
issues.body: Similar to the main SDF specification, the mapping file specification could also provide a JSO version of the CDDL schema.

issues.title: Further specify and implement augmentation logging mechanism
issues.author: JKRhb
issues.body:
For upcoming versions, the augmentation logging mechanism needs to be further fleshed out. We also need to collect implementation experience.

Notes from the [PR discussion](https://github.com/cabo/sdf-mapping/pull/4#discussion_r2185261688_):

- Provenance in info block via the mapping file?
- JSON Pointer feature: append to an array, could be used for logging
    - Challenge: find a place where to put this information
    - Need to specify that the log entry is either appended to an existing array or that a new array is created with the log entry
- Need to specify what happens if a JSON pointer points into "thin air" and not to a quality using an already registered quality name

comments.author: JKRhb
comments.body: Via https://github.com/cabo/sdf-mapping/pull/11, we have addressed a number of the points listed above, but I suppose we can still leave this issue open until we have finalized the section and discussed the additions with the working group.

issues.title: Evaluate whether JSON merge-patch already fulfills our requirements for references from Mapping Files
issues.author: JKRhb
issues.body:
Notes from the [PR Discussion](https://github.com/cabo/sdf-mapping/pull/4#discussion_r2185261688_):

- Hypothesis: Merge-patch _might_ be good enough, but maybe we have additional requirements
- Update text to make the distinction between augmented and resolved models clearer

comments.author: JKRhb
comments.body:
I think if we use #12 as a basis for going forward, we _could_ offer the possibility of defining other resolution algorithms via a new quality in addition to `target` and `patch` that could just default to using merge-patch if it isn't set. This might offer the greatest amount of flexibility if we should identify more use cases for which merge-patch is not enough.

However, the approach proposed in #12 has the downside of being a lot more verbose than the previous one.

issues.title: Additional document type that combines SDF model and Mapping files?
issues.author: JKRhb
issues.body:
I was wondering whether it would make sense to define an additional type of document that serves as a container of an SDF model and an arbitrary number of mapping files (all identified via a namespace or a URI). Processors could treat this type of document as an SDF model that has been augmented using all the mapping files referenced.

An example could look like this:

```yaml
info:
  title: Example for a container for an SDF model and mapping files
namespace:
  sdf-models: https://example.org/sdf-models
  mapping-file: https://example.org/mapping-file
model: sdf-model:#/example-model
mapping-files:
  - mapping-file:#/mapping-file1
  - mapping-file:#/mapping-file2
```

pulls.title: Add WoT TD reference and example for protocol bindings
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body:
This PR adds a reference to a WoT TD 1.1 Working Draft[^1] to the document and updates the WoT example with Protocol Bindings and some additional text.

[^1]: That is, unfortunately, quite outdated, but there is no more recent version available at [xml2rfc](https://xml2rfc.tools.ietf.org/public/rfc/bibxml-w3c/).

pulls.title: Update Jan's `org` and `email`
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body: Since my main affiliation has changed in the meantime, this PR updates it in the draft alongside the email address.

pulls.title: Start specifying augmentation mechanism
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body:
This PR tries to lay the groundwork for a formal specification of the augmentation mechanism for SDF mapping files. Currently, this PR only contains some text that sketches out the structure of this section and the requirements the augmentation mechanism needs to fulfill. However, there is probably a bit more discussion needed in the overall context of the document.

A rendered version of this PR can be found here: https://jkrhb.github.io/sdf-mapping/mechanism/draft-bormann-asdf-sdf-mapping.html#name-augmentation-mechanism

comments.body: We probably need to contrast (or compare) this to "resolved" SDF models which is a similar mechanism, but "pull" (via sdfRef).  Exploiting the similarities (e.g., using merge-patch) would be good, but we shouldn't unify what is different (e.g., maybe we want to have a more semantic approach than merge-patch?).

Representing instances as models has its problems; among others, there is no meta-model then (you cannot check that the instance has everything it needs and this is of the right type etc.).
We should clearly have an idea how instantiation is different from (model) derivation before we tackle the specifics.
Pseudocode may be a little earlynow; we probably want to describe the properties of the augmentation process first.

Shouldn't that be exactly like SDF?
Of course, we may want to have some way to "see" the augmentations even when they are in place, but maybe that is more of a namespace/qnp requirement?

> Shouldn't that be exactly like SDF?
> Of course, we may want to have some way to "see" the augmentations even when they are in place, but maybe that is more of a namespace/qnp requirement?

These are very good points, could we cover this by adding an assertion demanding that every additional quality needs to start with a prefix that corresponds with an entry from the `namespace` block? Or could/should this be included in the CDDL?

Notes:

- Provenance in info block via the mapping file?
- JSON Pointer feature: append to an array, could be used for logging
    - Challenge: find a place where to put this information
    - Need to specify that the log entry is either appended to an existing array or that a new array is created with the log entry
- Need to specify what happens if a JSON pointer points into "thin air" and not to a quality using an already registered quality name

Notes:
- Hypothesis: Merge-patch _might_ be good enough, but maybe we have additional requirements
- Update text to make the distinction between augmented and resolved models clearer

Notes:
- Clarify how the different types of documents fit together
- Do we need a third type of document besides SDF models and proofshots?
- Formulate a litmus test for determining when a document belongs to one of the two types above
- Review requirements based on NIPC draft, but it would be desirable to stick to one document for abstract models and one for instances
- "Third type" could only be existent "in memory"/after resolving the mappings, but we still need to specify the format that is the result of the resolution process
- Do we also need augmentation for instances?

```suggestion
Augmented SDF models can still be abstract in nature, but enriched with ecosystem-specific information that can be used as a basis for further augmentation.
```

It might also be necessary to specify an augmentation process for _instance_ descriptions, but this aspect is still open for debate.

Properties of the augmentation process:
- Iterate over all entries of the mapping file's `map` object and apply the merge-patch algorithm
  - Do we need to specify a way to define an order for the resolution of the JSON pointers?
    - Should we rather use an array to have an ordered list of entries?
    - Should we demand that the mappings are defined in such a way that the resolution order does not matter?

TODO: Replace with prose describing the properties of the algorithm

```suggestion
```

pulls.title: Improve augmentation algorithm prose
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body:
While trying to implement our current approach for the augmentation algorithm, I noticed that the description within the document is currently slightly incorrect (or rather: it doesn't work as it is described at the moment).

This PR tries to improve the prose by providing additional details and a first attempt describing error handling.

pulls.title: Expand Logging Augmentation section
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body: This PR contains an attempt at expanding the "Logging Augmentation" section with an example and additional text. I also made a first attempt at specifying a formal algorithm for the logging the augmentation chain, but that one still requires more discussion and probably some refinement.

pulls.title: Evaluate array-based `map` approach
pulls.author: JKRhb
pulls.body:
In this PR, I wanted to try specifying the `map` as an array of objects that each contain a `target` and a `patch` quality. This would resolve the problem of having a non-deterministic order of the entries in the `map` entry, although it makes things a lot more verbose. I still wanted to try out some examples here to get a feeling for how it would look like it practice.

The rendered version can be accessed here: https://jkrhb.github.io/sdf-mapping/alternative-map/

The diff is available here: https://author-tools.ietf.org/api/iddiff?url_1=https://JKRhb.github.io/sdf-mapping/draft-bormann-asdf-sdf-mapping.txt&url_2=https://JKRhb.github.io/sdf-mapping/alternative-map/draft-bormann-asdf-sdf-mapping.txt
